channel.title: Badgersaurus
channel.description: Punk Funk since '22. The personal hobbyist website of Piper K.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "That Little Girl From Stranger Things Or Whatever" Edition
item.description: Backend updates and... that's it really. Nothing to see here.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "A Quick One, While He's Away" Edition
item.description: Happy new year's! It's the annual State of the Badger Address plus some more link bullshit (sigh) and a special fun bonus page.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "Ocean Size" Edition
item.description: A tutorial on using Docker on Windows to selfhost software.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "Gamma Ray" Edition
item.description: A couple more drawings (normal this time) and the Closet index now exists. Weekly updates?? What the hell is going on !!!!

item.title: Badgersaurus - "Add It Up" Edition
item.description: Minor concert update, deeply embarrasing fanart I couldn't help myself from making, minor About adjustments.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "Baby Darling Dollface Honey" Edition
item.description: An update to the concert journal and absolutely nothing else.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "Your New Cuckoo" Edition
item.description: Art, album wall update, little fixes.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "Magic Christian Music" Edition
item.description: More links! I probably should've titled these updates after surf-rock songs. Oh well.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "Coal Miner's Daughter" Edition
item.description: The Surfin' page returns in all-new Yahoo-esque hyper-organized glory! Plus new art and minor housekeeping.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "Needles and Pins" Edition
item.description: The fabled Urusei Yatsura fanpage has finally been located somewhere in the jungles of the southern continent of the dragon planet, Pern. It is an unruly and large beast, covered in stripes and smelling vaguely of Billy Idol albums, making a striking new addition to the intergalactic menagerie of this web page.

item.title: Badgersaurus - "You Gonna Hafta Serve Somebody" Edition
item.description: RSS feed support (duh), a browser startpage you can download and configure for personal use, and some boring old general housekeeping updates.
